fields.description:
Jira 6.1 standalone, extracted from the .tar.gz, does not recognize/use the correctly-exported JIRA_HOME environment variable.

This was an attempt at upgrading from Jira 6.0.8. The same launch script, which correctly exports JIRA_HOME and then calls bin/start-jira.sh, worked fine for that version (6.0.8).

Setting jira.home in jira-application.properties still works, however. Tested on OpenIndiana with the Jira 6.1 standalone tarball release. Catalina.out is attached; the issue is 100% repeatable on this machine.
fields.summary: Jira 6.1 does not use JIRA_HOME environment variable

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Click on Issues dropdown from top bar, click on filter "My Open Issues" (or click from left sidebar link)
2. Choose a ticket from list (without changing search criteria)
3. Change status of ticket (eg, click "In Progress")
4. The list of issues disappears, and an empty search list with the same previous criteria is shown. (shown in screenshot). 

To get back to the list of issues, the query needs to be run again (e.g. press Enter or click "My Open Issues" again).\

The expected behaviour is that the issue that you were on (the one that no longer matches the query) disappears, and next issue in the list is selected.

The problem only happens when you're using a issue filter (e.g. "My Open Issues") to search for issues. If you use the same JQL *outside* of a filter the problem does not occur.
fields.summary: Changing an issue's status while using a filter displays empty page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34988].
  {panel}

When trying to separate projects into using a separate scheme for everything, as a user/ jira administrator I find that th field configurations and field configurations schemes by far the most confusing element possible .

What really throws me off is the screens that I see in the new project I am in process of creating! 

When I am looking at the new field configuration which is affected only to my new project, which has also a unique screen scheme with 1 single screen affected, I am seeing the multitiude of screens which are only relevant to other projects and even sometimes to some issue types which I do not have in this project. 

This is extremely confusing and even scary at first and even distracting. 
i.e I have to convince myself that the screens that appear in my brand new spanking Field configuration have no effect and that the things I do here will not affect the other field configuration. 

To relate my user experience, even after a few months of working extensively on configuring our JIRA for 3 different Projects, I find the 'multi project jira' really hard to configure. 

As another comment I'd suggest to have some kind of a new project creation wizard which could really simplify just how "separate" do you want this project to be from others (in terms of sharing or not the schemes with them), preferably in one or a handful off screens. 

Right now I'm dreading the day when I'll start configuring my next "separate"  project - I'll need to create 8 new schemes and several new configurations and go back and worth between System\Issues and Project\Administration to affect newly created schemes. 

Besides the wizard, there should be a really quick agile option create me a totally separate project with totally separate schemes and configs taking by default the name of the project so I do not have to create and  type Project X scheme 10 times... 

this is a major need, for I'd love to just create this totally separate project and just hand it over to a team leader so they configure to their heart's content and I would not have to worry that they mix up something in my other schemes because they forgot that they're sharing them with my other projects...
fields.summary: Field Configuration scheme should show only the screens applicable to the project

fields.description:
JIRA is not exiting cleanly and therefore renders the Tomcat shutdown.sh script malfunction. This needs to be fixed in order for JIRA restarts to be performed gracefully and no data corruption happens.


*Original request by the customer:*
In my experience with Jira (customer since v3.x), never once has shutdown.sh ever actually shut down tomcat. I propose that instead of having logic in the bash script to check to see if the process exited, you do one of the following:

* Issue a kill -9, because that's ultimately what it takes
* Change the PID test logic to just be an echo, because tomcat not quitting when asked is a simple statement of fact
fields.summary: Update shutdown.sh to be more realistic
Display last user that updated an issue

Thanks for your help!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34958].
  {panel}

When you navigate to a project > labels, there are labels shown are various cases: All caps, mixed case, all lower.

However, when you click on them to locate those, the search does not display based on case sensitivity.  So, I clicked on mixed case, the query is correct; but, the results shown don't match the query.  The results are showing all values, regardless of case. 

I need it to show the results for what is being requested. 

Attached is the screenshot that shows the labels of ATLAS, Atlas, and atlas. 

The other attachment shows that I clicked on the label of Atlas and the query is correct; but, the right for one of the issue details shows that it has the label of ATLAS and not Atlas.
fields.summary: Labels in search is not retrieving based on case sensitivity

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34955].
  {panel}

When an attempt is made to use the Notification Helper to debug a "why is JIRA refusing to send email" problem, a modal dialog appears over the page which is larger than the page as per the attached screen.

For reasons unknown scrolling of the screen is disabled, and so it is impossible to reach whatever "ok" or "cancel" buttons that might allow the user to continue.

This renders the Notification Helper less helpful.

*Workaround*
Resize/Maximize the browser window to view the complete content of the dialog.
Put it in fullscreen mode if maximizing doesn't help.
fields.summary: "Notification Helper" UI disables scroll, places OK off screen

fields.description:
Hi,
I just installed the evaluation of JIRA 6.0.8.x64 on Windows Server 2008 R2.
In the wizard, I selected to link JIRA to my own MS SQL Database on SQL Server 2008. I created the table and connected JIRA to it. Then I created an admin account in the wizard, clicked next. I got on the Dashboard page (the widgets are both displaying an error) and when I try to login with the freshly created admin account I get the error :
"Sorry, your username and password are incorrect - please try again."

I didn't do anything on the database, just followed the wizard and I can't login. I tried to uninstall an install again, but still doesn't work.

When looking at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Retrieving+the+JIRA+Administrator#RetrievingtheJIRAAdministrator-1.Senditviaemail, I looked at the content of the 'cwd_user' table but there is no user account in there. What could be the problem? how can I see a log somewhere to see what could be going wrong? thanks
fields.summary: Cannot log in as Administrator right after Setup Wizard

Customers are left without much information when they are unable to display images in issue description or comment.

It would be great if there's a message pointing the customer to what is irking and need to be fixed.

For the issue to be fixed the below workaround has to be applied:
Editing the Configuration Settings that were preventing the attachments from:

To
* Workaround Policy: Work around Internet Explorer security hole

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34948].
  {panel}

In JIRA 6.1, it is possible to [rename a project key|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Editing+a+Project+Key?from=SvEC]. However, the attachment directory still mapped to the old project key directory. (Described [Here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Editing+a+Project+Key#EditingaProjectKey-Notesforchangemanagement])

h4.Current Behavior:
- User renamed a project key from "ABC" to "KLM"
- In $JIRA-HOME/data/attachment directory, the attachment is still located under ABC directory. This somehow created some confusion to browse the attachment manually.

h4.Suggested Behavior:
- Ideally, the attachment directory should be renamed to the new project key ("KLM").
fields.summary: Migrate the attachment data to new directory post renaming project key

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34945].
{panel}
In JIRA Server 6.1, it is possible to [rename a project key|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Editing+a+Project+Key?from=SvEC]. However, it is not possible to use a used project key in Jira cloud.
h4. Current Behavior:
 * Let's say user has renamed a project key from "ABC" to "KLM"
 * Although there is no project uses the project key ABC, user is *not* allowed to re-use "ABC" for the new project key.

h4. Suggested behavior:
 * Ideally, user should be able to re-use the project key "ABC" for other/new project
fields.summary: Ability to re-use a used project key

If you perform a search in the Issue Navigator (I'm using the _My Open Issues_ filter), it will bring some results:

!initial.png|thumbnail!

But if you perform a transition in the Detail View, such as "Start Progress", the filter results will disappear:

fields.description:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34927].
  {panel}

I would like to re-open this issue as the current behaviour seems counterintuitive.

If Jira want to support it's use as a ticketting tool, then this is clearly something that would add value to Jira.

In some cases users go to great length to create emails that contain multiple screenshots to document their case. Yet Jira decouples the images from the email content and adds them as attachment.
Since the email handler creates the attachments from the received email (and thus knows the filenames of all created attachments) it can easily insert these filenames in the comment or description it creates from the email.

In this way the issues created through email do not loose their meaning as they sometimes do now.

--- original text from cloned issue ---

Comments left when attaching a file are usually specifically for that attachment.  The way Jira separates the attachment from the comment on the ticket is confusing and many times makes the comment less effective.  I've started to make it a habit to always include a link to the attachment at the beginning of my comment to maintain the connection between the two (using the \[\^attachment.ext\] syntax).

Is there any way to make this a default behavior for all attachment comments?  In other words, make the final comment a concatenation of "attachment link" and "attachment comment".  For example:

{noformat}
[^screenshot.png]

Here's a screenshot of the issue I'm seeing.
{noformat}
fields.summary: Automatically include attachment link in attachment comment
Inception Feedback on the feedback form
New renderer that decides text or wiki rendering based on content size

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34911].
  {panel}

*Current Behaviour:*
When inserting the 'Pie Chart' macro into a Confluence page and using the same filter, the preview screen does not render.  _Example attached_

The jira logs report:
{noformat}2013-09-16 23:44:39.964113500 2013-09-16 23:44:39,964 TP-Processor16 WARN sysadmin 1424x57799x1 ninlds 59.167.133.100,131.103.27.196 /charts [jira.charts.jfreechart.DisplayChartServlet] File not found, returning 404 (filename='jfreechart-onetime-5137764596391221134.png').{noformat}

*Expected Behaviour:*
The expected behaviour of the JIRA pie-chart macro is available when using the macro as a gadget in the dashboard.  Selecting an available filter displays the related issues.  _Example attached_

The location of the gadget is: https://<instance>/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:pie-chart-gadget/gadgets/piechart-gadget.xml

The same behaviour has also been observed in the 'Created v. Resolved' macro.

Additionally, existing macros that were saved, now have no charts being displayed within the Confluence page, _example attached_
fields.summary: 'Pie Chart' and 'Created v. Resolved' macro preview do not display when used in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34902].
  {panel}

When we transition to Closed, one of the required fields is resolution. 
However, in most all cases, resolution is already populated when it is Resolved - it could be fixed, complete, answered, cannot reproduce,etc. 

However, since it is required, you have to input something and the transition then changes everything in that bulk action to the one selected. 

Consequently, you have to filter out by resolution before doing a bulk transition which is inefficient. 

Either don't make resolution required (and if it's not done, those issues don't complete the transition); or, only override the resolution if one doesn't exist (it is currently unresolved). 

Else the integrity of the data is affected.
fields.summary: Do not override existing resolutions in a bulk transition
Search by createdDate should account for a whole day and not midnight of a specific day

Ability to edit sub-task fields displayed on parent issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34886].
  {panel}

As per [Retry policy:|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/webhooks/#retry-policy]
{quote}If a webhook is sent to its callback URL but fails, Jira Cloud will attempt to resend it up to five times. Each subsequent attempt is delayed with a randomized exponential back-off algorithm. The first retry occurs after at least 10 seconds, and the last between 15 and 30 minutes from the first failure.
{quote}

Sometimes webhooks may take a while to complete, either due to poor network connections, or due to long processing times on the remote application, we should allow configurable timeouts to help end users work around this issue.

h3. Why This Is Important

It's important to reduce the amount of retry messages in the external system
h3. Workaround

Use X-Atlassian-Webhook-Retry in header to identify retry requests and skip them.
fields.summary: Allow configureable timeouts for webhooks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

*Actual behaviour:*

templates/email/html/contactadministrator.vm
{noformat}

!Screen Shot 2013-09-17 at 5.25.49 PM.png!

You can reply to the mail and ask for details as the mail sender is preserved.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34881].
  {panel}

According to the documentation [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Global+Permissions#ManagingGlobalPermissions-About'JIRASystemAdministrators'and'JIRAAdministrators'], only JIRA System Administrators are allowed to configure Application Links . 

But from the test, JIRA Administrators are able to add, remove and configure application link. 

However, only OAuth authentication can be created. 

*Steps to reproduce* 
* Create User A with JIRA System Administrators global permission.
* Create User B with JIRA Administration global permission.
* Login with User B and navigate to {{Administration >> Add-ons >> Application Links}}
* Create an application link.
fields.summary: JIRA Administrators can configure application link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34880].
  {panel}

h5.Steps to reproduce:

- Create a condition to a workflow step.
- Add a grouped condition.
- Now your grouped condition looks something like:

!condition.png!

- Try to switch the logic of the condition so that the inner condition be (any) and outer condition be (all), but you will notice you can't. Only the outer condition can be (any) and the inner will always be reset to (all), but iyou should be able to change it as per:

!condition2.png!
fields.summary: Unable to switch a grouped condition's logic (Workflow Editing)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34878].
  {panel}

Actually, when using advanced search, fields like for example the resolution, are not showing the translated values.

For example the resolution "Duplicate" translated to "Duplikat" in german.
in JQL I would have to write:
resolution = Duplicate

instead of:
resolution = Duplikat

Some users do never see the original, english version of the resolution,
thus are having trouble to search for.
fields.summary: Use translations in advanced search

I create many more screens in a roll than I would like. So this would make my life easier. And by "life easier", I mean I would save ONE click per screen creation.

When you click Screen > Add Screen and name it, it goes to the screen where you can select the fields to be displayed in this screen. 

After choosing the fields, I need to click Screen > Add Screen again. Would be better if I could just click an "Add Screen" from the configure screen screen.

This gets in your nervs when you already have a thousand screens and is creating another thousand. The time it takes to load the "Screen" page - with the screens list - is too damn -high- long.

fields.description:
Currently we have been trying both on our test system and on our Production system to create a full XML backup of JIRA data and have come across an error which does not allow the backup to finish. It mainly stops and say unable to backup to filename.zip. 
Having looked in the logs it looks like there is a 4GB limitations like you can see in the log:
2013-09-15 05:43:03,132 http-80-36 ERROR karl.wilson 331x4900012x1 x4eb8a 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/XmlBackup.jspa [jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultExportService] Error during XML backup.
org.apache.commons.compress.archivers.zip.Zip64RequiredException: entities.xml's size exceeds the limit of 4GByte.

Could you please help to find a workaround as we may need to move our data from MS-SQL to Oracle.
Thanks,

Karl
fields.summary: JIRA Full backup to XML - ZIP 4GB limitation.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

Cannot switch to classic view mode permanently. Only as administrator I can view and edit workflow in classic mode.

How can I configure the classic view mode as default for all users?

Steps to Reproduce:
-   https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/workflows/ListWorkflows.jspa
- Next to any workflow, click view under operations
- Click the Diagram button
- Click the Enter classic mode link
- There is no way to retain these settings so that you are taken to Classic Mode when returning to this workflow.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34824].
  {panel}

After spending too much time on the Atlassian website this weekend I've encountered two small issues 

Broken links:
https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorial/git-branches#!merge has two links rebasing, git status which don't seem to work anymore (404).

After requesting an evaluation licence of Bamboo I received a survey popup which had a small css issue, I've attached the screenshot where the Submit button over the last drop down list. I'm currently working with Chrome Version 29.0.1547.66 m.

Hope it helps!
fields.summary: Attlasian website css issue + broken links

fields.description:
After latest updates our JIRA on demand is working incredible slower.
We did not observe any speed downgrade for other online apps or services we are using. We are still at the same Internet connection.

Could you be so kind to check what is the problem? It is almost impossible to work.

BCMLogiv
fields.summary: After latest updates our JIRA on demand is working incredible slower
Project avatar still updates if you cancel the 'Edit Project' modal screen in Project Admin
I cant stand it any more - can we do a  count of projects on the project page

The following situation results in an error with the issue view screen:
* Workflow step has the property:
{code}

Issue View screen shows:
!issue-view-error.png|thumbnail!
* There is no option to assign the issue to an user.

h4. Workaround
* Remove the *jira.permission.assign.issue* property from your workflow step.
fields.summary: jira.permission.assign.issue causes issue view errors
Mobile access: Desktop View on Android 4.1 and greater
Mobile access: ability to edit issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34813].
  {panel}

h3. Overview
In the current mail handler system, if you uncheck the "Create Users" box, the system will silently ignore any incoming messages from unknown addresses. It would be beneficial to be able to configure a reply message to let the sender know that their ticket wasn't created.

h3. Our Use Case
We recently we rolled out new email addresses for a segment of our user-base. Since we're OnDemand, we can't use Crowd or integrate with our AD environment, so needed each profile to be touched individually to update the addresses, and there were enough users affected that we had to rely on the users to update their own. Unfortunately, users who failed to update their profile were not courteous enough to stop emailing our helpdesk, and each request got bounced by the system without informing the users that there was an issue.

h3. Additional Requirements
In addition to just a configurable email, we should be able to black or whitelist domains to reply to. This is important for people running web-accessible instances, since spam-bots and other undesirables will latch onto a reply and go nuts.
fields.summary: Allow Reply to Unknown Users for Mail Handlers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34812].
  {panel}

When exporting a search to excel in issue navigator, not all columns are exported.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# create a custom field
# make it available for two issue types (bug, improvement for instance)
# create some issues and populate this custom field
# now, perform a search on the issue navigator: 'project = X' for instance
# add the custom field as a column on the issue navigator
(i) make sure the column is being displayed
# export to excel (current fields / all fields)

h4. Expected behaviour 
custom field is exported as well

h4. Actual behaviour 
the custom field is not exported

h4. Workaround
# change the search on the issue navigator to include the issue types the custom field is available for: 'project = X AND issuetype = Bug'
# export to Excel (current fields) one more time. Now, the custom field is exported
fields.summary: Export to excel (current fields) does not show all columns present in the issue navigator
Pivotal Integration Plugin should update with JIRA ID

fields.description:
XSRF Security Token Missing


Your browser has not provided any parameters at all and your input has been lost. Press back now to try and resend the data. This is most likely caused by a bug in the browser. FireFox 3.6.0 have been known to exhibit this behavior.

 For more information see this bug report http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-20696

JIRA could not complete this action due to a missing form token.

You may have cleared your browser cookies, which could have resulted in the expiry of your current form token. A new form token has been reissued.

 Request URL: /secure/admin/LookAndFeel!uploadLogo.jspa 


JIRA administrators

 Please refer to this page for details on disabling form token checking.

fields.summary: RSS feeds generate internal error after authentication, seems related to captcha?
Add a way to connect JIRA releases to Bamboo Builds after build is complete
Have the ability to go to Permission Schemes, Notification Schemes, Issue Security Schemes and Saved Filters from a user group

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34803].
  {panel}

As a Jira OnDemand admin I would like to customise fields in the Summary panel so that they better relate to the project space.

I have assigned values to a project's version ("Iteration 9", "Iteration 10", "Iteration 11"), but can't call them "Versions", because the developers of the software that this project applies to don't have versions as such. Instead developments are done in _Iterations_ only. In effect the iteration has become the version.

I was looking to rename field _Fix Version/s_ to _Assign to Iteration_, but it doesn't seem possible.

I previously logged this as [JST-74242|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-74242].
fields.summary: Have the ability to customise fields in the Summary panel
Have the ability to add groups to groups
Have the option to use a drop-down control with images

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34800].
  {panel}

This is an improvment suggestion regarding the settings in the field configuration.
We have many fields that are not used any more which mean that I have to hide a lot of fields when making my field configuration.
It would really help if it was possible to select several fields and perform the same operation "hide" for all of them instead of setting them one by one.

And it would be really useful to select if you want to display hidden fields or only see required fields with a filter function.
Kind regards,
Katarina
fields.summary: Possibility to change multiple fields in field configuration at the same time.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34799].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
Issue navigator will have interface design issue when more columns are selected to be shown in the issue navigator

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Select more columns of the issue field (which then requires users to scroll right to view the rest of the column)
# Scroll right the navigation bar

h4. Expected Result
Issue Navigator will expand the interface to the right side

h4. Actual Result
Issue navigator shows *empty space* at the top of issue navigator, as highlighted in the screenshot below
!nav.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue navigator alignment issue
Quick swap between JIRA Project and Confluence Space
Configuration of Default Comment and Worklog Visibility on Project Level
I have no idea where my field is rendered once I add a value to it.
